alert.note: Alert for Big Island Summit; Haleakala Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 16 at 3:54AM HST until January 17 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH 6 PM HST WEDNESDAY FOR HIGHEST SUMMITS OF THE BIG ISLAND AND HALEAKALA ON MAUI... ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH MIDNIGHT HST TONIGHT FOR NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI LANAI AND FOR LOWER ELEVATIONS ON MAUI AND THE BIG ISLAND... .South to southwest winds will increase quickly to advisory levels by mid to late morning and continue through this evening as a cold front approaches from the west. Southwest winds will also increase to warning levels across the high summits of the Big Island and Haleakala on Maui this morning and continue through Wednesday. ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...On the Big Island summits, southwest winds increasing to 55 to 75 mph with higher gusts. On the high summit of Haleakala on Maui, southwest winds increasing to 50 to 60 mph with higher gusts. * WHERE...The high summits of the Big Island and Haleakala on Maui. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can make driving and walking dangerous. The winds can forcefully open doors and damage hinges or slam doors shut, possibly causing injuries.
info.instruction: Be prepared for road-closures. Postpone travel to the summits until conditions improve.
